page.title: 12LIVING IN A l7th CENT.HOUSE1
page.content: Within our walls there had been four families and a bake-house.At another time there had been a greengrocer's in the area of our small front room.In l952 it was converted to a four bedroomed house.The frontage has had to remain unchanged, though the original front door is now a window and the front garden and wall have been removed.It is a traditional stone house with harling and pantiled roof. The walls are 3'thick.LIVINGROOM 25'xl5'roof open to eaves.Walls-white paint and cedar panels.Danish wood-burning stove on tiled hearth with polished slate surfaces.Fitted beige carpet;piano;flower-patterned settee;2 leather chairs;cane chair; cream curtains;large double-glazed window;2 small windows;wooden hexagon- al coffee table,slate surface;3 sag- bags;colour T.V.;gas central heating.
